description.narrative: Output 2.6: WASH in schools, monastic schools and nunneries effectively implemented and water sanitation and hygiene promoted through advocacy and demand,

mailing-address.narrative: Lhaki Lham 1-11 P.O. Box 239 Thimphu Bhutan

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

title.narrative: Bhutan United Nations Development Assistance Framework 2014-2018
United Nations Sustainable Development Partnership Framework for Bhutan 2019-2023
UNICEF Programmes in Bhutan (Communication for Development)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Bhutan 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Bhutan Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.6: WASH in schools, monastic schools and nunneries effectively implemented and water sanitation and hygiene promoted through advocacy and demand,

description.narrative: Additional 3,544 school children, 11,572 child monks and 680 child nuns have benefited from improved WASH facilities, capacity building, advocacy, and enhanced WASH behaviours. The MIS questionnaire for monastic institutions is ready to collect cross-sectoral information and real-time data on regular basis from 2019 onwards. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
